Author weaves a satirical, political thriller of a man's dilemma between helping a murder case and protecting his wife's campaign
REDWOOD CITY, Calif. , Oct. 15, 2015 /PRNewswire/ -- A man's seemingly innocent hobby of flying a model drone turns into a nightmare when he accidentally captures a video of a woman being murdered by drowning. What would he do when he's confronted with a huge dilemma: his state senator wife who's running for governor of California centers her political platform on privacy issues in this digital age; and the victim's very wealthy, influential and powerful husband threatens him if he presents the video evidence to the police? Author Pete Liebengood's newly published lighthearted political thriller, Accidental Droning , is an entertaining novel that gathers an interesting mix of characters who will do anything and everything for money, politics, revenge – and perhaps, love.
Former country club golf shop manager Bo Granger turned to flying his private hobby drone as a pastime. When his drone accidentally captured footage of a man drowning a woman in a pool in their very private, exclusive neighborhood, he didn't realize that it would spark up a series of misadventures for him. He would be nearly shot to death by a hit man hired by the dead woman's husband; be falsely accused of sexual abuse by his wife's housekeeper; and be involved in a torrid affair with a journalist.
"An enjoyable romp of a political backstabbing and manipulation." – Kirkus Reviews
"... an entertaining setup for a comedic cast of characters that wreak havoc on themselves and each other as they try to navigate self-serving interests with the (rarely invoked) greater good." – Clarion Review, Foreword
"... a mystery that is packed with unexpected twists, turns, and influences throughout..." – Donovan's Bookshelf
This book is available online and can be purchased at www.amazon.com and www.barnesandnoble.com .
About the Author
Pete Liebengood is a retired TV sportscaster (KCRA-TV Sacramento, KRON-TV San Francisco). He contributed as a play-by-play announcer for ESPN, working college basketball and football games, boxing, tennis, skiing and rodeo. He was co-creator and producer of one of the first local TV news magazine shows called "Seven Thirty". His first novel, Class of '62 , was published by Moradal in 2012.
Accidental Droning by Pete Liebengood
